questions.question_text: Which statement describes the data loss prevention (DLP) add-on?

choices.A: It prevents phishing attacks by controlling the sites to which users can submit valid corporate credentials.
choices.B: It employs automated policy enforcement to allow trusted behavior with a new Device-ID policy construct.
choices.C: It is a centrally delivered cloud service with unified detection policies that can be embedded in existing control points.
choices.D: It enables data sharing with third-party tools such as security information and event management (SIEM) systems.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Agree with D, see below:
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/best-practices/zero-trust-best-practices/zero-trust-best-practices/the-five-step-methodology/step-5-monitor-and-maintain-the-network

choices.A: Step 4: Create the Zero Trust policy
choices.B: Step 3: Architect a Zero Trust network
choices.D: Step 5: Monitor and maintain the network

questions.question_text: In which step of the Five-Step Methodology for implementing the Zero Trust model does inspection and logging of all traffic take place?

In an SD-WAN deployment, what allows customers to modify resources in an automated fashion instead of logging on to a central controller or using command-line interface (CLI) to manage all their configurations?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The correct answer should be C

https://www.paloaltonetworks.com/cyberpedia/how-does-sd-wan-automation-simplify-network-operations#:~:text=Through%20the%20power%20of%20application,manage%20all%20of%20their%20configurations.

Selected Answer: C
Automated fashion = API, so C.
Any other answers makes no sense, it is C
